alert.note: Alert for Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 19 at 2:36AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT FOR HANCOCK...SOUTHWESTERN MCDONOUGH AND SOUTHERN LEE COUNTIES... At 236 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Nauvoo, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. This severe storm will be near... Colusa around 240 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Hamilton, Ferris, Adrian, Carthage, Burnside, Elvaston, Basco, Bentley, Webster, Denver, Bowen, Colmar, Augusta, Plymouth and Hancock County Fairgrounds. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
